posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: Nós estamos com dúvida em como usar esse botões. Alguém pode nos ajudar?

posts.name: Max Morehead
posts.cooked: You should be able to open the driver station and see which button number is activated when you click those buttons. Then you can use getRawButton or similar WPILib functions to retrieve the corresponding button in code.

posts.name: Sean Paxman I 9191
posts.cooked: These buttons aren't available on the driver station by default, so download the controller software and rebind r4 and l4 to buttons you won't use, such as the dpad.

posts.name: Burak Şükür
posts.cooked: The controller is the Gamesir G7 SE, and you can find a tutorial on their website at https://gamesir.com/pages/tutorial-how-to-use-gamesir-g7-se. To adjust the R4/L4 button values, hold the M+R4/L4 buttons simultaneously for 3 seconds. Tap the desired button when the indicator blinks slowly; the button will turn solid after tapping to confirm its value has been set. For cancellation, follow the same initial steps but tap the R4/L4 button instead.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: You can assign different functions to them so they act as a unique button in the control, but you simply use them in your code as if they were that specific button.

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked: Can I have your Instagram? Some questions are asked of you, thank you!

suggested_topics.title: How do we set up a button box in our code
suggested_topics.fancy_title: How do we set up a button box in our code
suggested_topics.excerpt: Try something like this. GenericHID someHid = new GenericHID(1); Trigger btn1 = new Trigger(()->someHid.getRawButtonPressed(1)); btn1.whileTrue(someCommand);
